titles.title: Gädlä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus “Vita of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus” / Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus “Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus “Vita of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus” (fols. 7ra-96vb) II) Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus “Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus”: 11 miracles (fols. 98ra-117ra).
Additiones 1-5.

copyists.copyist: The name of the scribe, Tǝsbǝʾtä Qal, who wrote Additiones 2-3 and inserted the names of the donors, is mentioned in the concluding supplication formula of Text I, fol. 96vb.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased from supplication formulas (s. also Additio 2). Later the Ms. was donated by ʾabunä Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (s. Additiones 2-3). His name and names of his family members are written in supplication formulas, within the text or in the margin: Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (fols. 39rb, 76rb, 87ra, 96vb, 105rb), his father Gäbrä Mädḫǝn (fol. 39rb), his mother ʾAmätä Śǝllase (fols. 39rb, 87ra), his wife Wälättä Śǝllase (fols. 96vb, 105rb, 114ra), their children Ḥablä Dǝngǝl (fols. 87ra, 96vb) and Wäldä Mikaʾel (fols. 87ra, 96vb).

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 18th cent. - first half of the 19th cent. (?)

txstates.txstate: Both boards are detached from the textblock (the back board has been placed upside down) The spine cover is missing. The original sewing is missing; partly substituted with recent threads. Many leaves are stained with water. The outer margin of fol. 1 is cut out and that of fol. 7 is damaged. The upper margin of fol. 101 is damaged, with the loss of text. A hole on fol. 98 is repaired with a piece of rosy thread. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 9, 32, 40, 95, 96.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark brown leather cover (at least 7 tools were used: fourfold line fillet, triple line fillet, double circle, interlaced line fillet, criss-cross, wave form, cross hatching).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
A(6; s.l.: 2, stub after 2; 5, stub before 5/fols. 1r-6v) – I(10/fols. 7r-16v) – II(10/fols. 17r-26v) – III(10/fols. 27r-36v) – IV(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 3; 8, stub after 3/fols. 37r-46v) – V(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 3; 8, stub after 7/fols. 47r-56v) – VI(10/fols. 57r-66v) – VII(10/fols. 67r-76v) – VIII(10/fols. 77r-86v) – IX(11; s.l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 87r-97v) – X(12; s.l.: 4, stub after 4; 9, stub after 8/fols. 98r-109v) – XI(8; s.l.: 1, no stub; 7, stub after 6/fols. 110r-117v).
Quire A consists of two loose fols. 2, 5 and one loose bifolio (3, 4) inserted between fols. 1 and 6.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Second half of the 18th century - first half of the 19th century (?)

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; two lines (alternating with a black line) on the incipit page of Texts I-II; selected lines in Text I; incipit of each miracle in Text II; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. The second component of the names of the donors (fol. 39rb) and two lines on fol. 117ra-rb are rubricated in vivid vermilion, in a secondary hand.

additional.cont: Fols. 2va-6rb: Täˀamrä Giyorgis, “Miracles of George”: 3 miracles.
additional.det: The text is written in the main hand. Nomina sacra, name of the protagonist or the word qǝddus “saint”, two lines of the incipit and incipit of the miracles are rubricated. The ruling of fols. 1 and 6 is the same as that of Texts I-II. On fols. 2r-5v there are 30 lines. The name Gäbrä Ḥǝywät is written at the end of the text on fol. 6rb, in the same hand as Additiones 2-3.

The note is crudely written by the secondary hand of Tǝsbǝʾtä Qal (s. also Additiones 3 and 4). It states that the Ms. was purchased by ʾabunä Gäbrä Ḥǝywät and donated to the Bet Ḥawaryat church. Subsequently, it mentions ʾabunä Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, his wife Wälättä Śǝllase and ʾabunä Gäbrä Mädḫǝn.

The note is crudely written by the secondary hand of Tǝsbǝʾtä Qal (s. also Additiones 2 and 4). It states that the Ms. belongs to the the Bet Ḥawaryat church as well as to ʾabunä Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, ʾabunä Gäbrä Mädḫǝn and his wife Wälättä Śǝllase.

The note is crudely written, by the secondary hand of Tǝsbǝʾtä Qal (s. also Additiones 2 and 3), over an almost completely erased text (probably the original donation note). It states that the Ms. was donated to the Bet Ḥawaryat church by Gäbrä Ḥǝywät and Wälättä Śǝllase.

additional.cont: Fol. 117r: Magical recipe.
additional.det: The note is carefully written in the main hand.

extras.extra: - Omitted letters or words are written interlineally, in a secondary hand: fols. 7vb, 8va, 9rb, 10rab. - Minor notes, writing exercises, doodles: e.g., fols. 1rv, 2rv, 6v, 7r, 14r, 17r, 28r, 33r, 41r, 76v, 77r, 86v, 97v, 98r, 107v, 108r, 116va, 117v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days of the week written in the upper margin of some fols., in a secondary hand: በእለተ፡ ሠሉስ: fol. 27va በእለተ፡ ረቡዕ: fol. 39ra በእለተ፡ ሐሙስ: fol. 61va በእለተ፡ ዓርብ: fol. 76rb በእለተ፡ ቀዳሚት: fol. 86vb በእለተ፡ ዕሑድ: fol. 93rb.
